verbs.description: persuade (third-person singular simple present persuades, present participle persuading, simple past and past participle persuaded)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To successfully convince (someone) to agree to, accept, or do something, usually through reasoning and verbal influence. [from 15th c.]
examples: That salesman was able to persuade me into buying this bottle of lotion.

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To convince of by argument, or by reasons offered or suggested from reflection, etc.; to cause to believe (something). [15th–18th c.]
(transitive, now rare, regional) To urge, plead; to try to convince (someone to do something). [from 16th c.]
examples: He persuaded me to go home, but I refused.
